abstract.p: American Rivers exec vice pres Ann C Mills letter holds that federal government should repair threatening dams, or remove them (Jacques Leslie Jan 22 Op-Ed)

block.p: Re ''Before the Flood,'' by Jacques Leslie (Op-Ed, Jan. 22):
Re ''Before the Flood,'' by Jacques Leslie (Op-Ed, Jan. 22):
Dams can fail; it's a lesson New England learned in 2005 and 2006, but may already have forgotten.

Global warming is causing glaciers to melt, rivers to swell and stronger storms; and it's only going to get worse. Mr. Leslie is right: the Kaloko Dam disaster on the Hawaiian island of Kauai that killed seven is a harbinger of things to come. We are not ready. More than half of the country's dams that pose a threat to human life currently aren't even required to have an emergency plan.
But Mr. Leslie does not mention one of the best, most economic options for many dangerous dams -- taking them out.

The federal government needs to be there with the resources to repair threatening dams, or remove them. States must act immediately to set emergency plans, inform communities of the risk and begin removing dangerous dams that cannot be made safe.
Ready or not, spring floods are coming.
Ann C. Mills Executive Vice President American Rivers Washington, Jan. 23, 2007
